learning_objective: Evaluate the tradeoffs in how data elements are organized and where data is stored.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "In biology class, Alex is studying different ecosystems and mapping them out with their biodiversity. They have two options on how to organize the data: in a 2D grid where each cell represents a different species or in a 3D model where the X-axis represents one ecosystem, the Y-axis represents another ecosystem, and the Z-axis represents different species. What might be a tradeoff Alex should consider when deciding how to store and organize their data?",
    "Answer1": "A 2D grid is simple to understand and work with, but it may limit the number of ecosystems Alex can represent.",
    "Answer2": "A 3D model can represent more information, but it may be harder to visualize.",
    "Answer3": "A 3D model is easier to work with because it can store more data.",
    "Answer4": "A 2D grid is always better because it is simpler.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "Option 1 is correct. A 2D grid representation is easier to understand and work with but could limit the number of ecosystems that Alex can represent, whereas a 3D model can store more information but may be complicated and harder to visualize and interpret."
}
